definition: to cast off (in knitting)/to sew a finishing hem/to close up (of wound)/to heal
to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: A bit tinny on the finish but that should disappear with barrel ageing.
sentences.chinese: 收口带有一丝锡的味道，但经过橡木桶陈酿即会消失。

sentences.english: Bottom edge, with full-flavoured natural sexual freedom.
sentences.chinese: 下摆收口自然卷边，随性自由。

sentences.english: Do not wear pleated pants or narrow-cut pants.
sentences.chinese: 不要穿着打褶的和收口的裤子。

sentences.english: Selective principle of reefed drag area and time reefed is discussed.

sentences.english: The wound in his arm has begun to close up.

sentences.english: The machine uses the clamp to close the cap and fasten it on the edge of bottle mouth.

sentences.english: Like unhealed wound, the bitterness still can be tasted.
sentences.chinese: 好像伤没有收口，苦味在舌间。

to close up/to heal (of wound)/to keep one's lips sealed
